title.narrative: Community Development Through Traditional Weaving, Natural Dyes, and Expansion of Community Tourism

description.narrative: Support civil society as an effective arena that empowers citizens to advance democratic values of citizen participation and governmental accountability. This includes supporting an enabling legal environment that protects and promotes civil society and civic action; providing capacity development assistance to CSOs; supporting civic participation; bolstering government oversight and accountability activities; strengthening a democratic political culture that values civic engagement, tolerance, and respect for human rights; and strengthening independent and democratic trade/labor unions. Civil society organizations includes, but is not limited to, human rights organizations, youth movements, informal groups, religious organizations, labor and trade unions, professional associations, indigenous organizations, women organizations, LGBT organizations, and think tanks.

This award strives to support civil society as an effective arena that empowers citizens to advance democratic values of citizen participation and governmental accountability. More specifically, this includes Asociación de Artesanos Andinos (AAA) will continue to revive the local Andean weaving tradition and will undertake a program of community tourism, thereby benefiting 350 female and male Quechua and Aymara weavers from 19 communities in the department of Cochabamba. description.narrative: U.S. assistance provides training and targeted support for Bolivian counternarcotics efforts; helps the Bolivian military in its peacekeeping and natural disaster response roles; improves healthcare quality and access; conserves biodiversity; and strengthens local governments and citizen participation. The United States will work with the Government of Bolivia (GOB), civil society, and the private sector to promote a more democratic state, healthier population, and improved environmental conservation.
